meanings.definition: To fry quickly in a little hot fat.
meanings.sent1: I will saute the vegetables for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: She likes to saute garlic in olive oil for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to saute the onions with a dance in his step.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to saute the horizon with its golden rays.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the saute pan filled the kitchen with enticing aromas.

meanings.definition: Fried quickly in a little hot fat.
meanings.sent1: The dish was cooked saute and tasted delicious.
meanings.sent2: The shrimp was saute and perfectly seasoned.
meanings.sent3: The bacon sizzled saute in the pan, tempting everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of saute food wafted through the house, making mouths water.
meanings.sent5: The vegetables were saute, creating a delightful crunch in every bite.
